Drawing and writing: I would use drawing and writing to communicate with others. Drawing and writing are universal languages that can be used to convey complex ideas and emotions. I could use these methods to communicate with my family, friends, and colleagues.

Communication apps: I would use communication apps to communicate with others. There are many communication apps available that use text-based communication, such as WhatsApp and Facebook Messenger. These apps would allow me to communicate with people from all over the world.

Mouth spelling: I would learn mouth spelling to communicate with others. Mouth spelling is a way of communicating using hand gestures and facial expressions. It is a great way to communicate with people who are deaf or hard of hearing.

Lip reading: I would learn lip reading to communicate with others. Lip reading is a way of reading the movements of the lips to understand what someone is saying. It is a great way to communicate with people who are deaf or hard of hearing.
